\u0218eful ONU a solicitat din nou tutur: The U.N. chief again urged all parties, including the divided U.N. Security Council, to unite and support inclusive negotiations to find a political solution.
Ban a declarat miercuri \u00een cadrul u: Ban told a news conference Wednesday that he plans to meet with foreign ministers of the five permanent council nations - the U.S., Russia, China, Britain and France - on the sidelines of the General Assembly's ministerial session later this month to discuss Syria.

8 cifre din sondaje care arat\u0103 c\u0: 8 Poll Numbers That Show Donald Trump Is For Real
Unii au \u00eencercat s\u0103 \u00eel et: Some have tried to label him a flip-flopper.

\u00cens\u0103 indiferent de modul \u00e: But no matter how some Republicans are trying to drag Donald Trump down from atop the polls, it hasn't worked (yet).

Iar motivele pentru care s-ar lupta din: And there are many reasons he would struggle in a general election.
\u00cens\u0103 grupurile din exterior pr: But outside groups like Jeb Bush's Super PAC and the economic conservative group Club for Growth are recognizing Trump's staying power and beginning to unload their dollars to topple him.
\u00cen continuare v\u0103 prezent\u0103: Here are some recent poll numbers that suggest that the real estate mogul isn't just a passing phase:
Cifrele care indic\u0103 sus\u021binerea: Trump's favorability ratings have turned 180 degrees.
Chiar \u00eenainte ca Donald Trump s\u01: Right before Donald Trump announced his candidacy in mid-June, a Monmouth University poll showed only two in 10 Republicans had a positive view of the real estate mogul.

\u00cen prezent, \u0219ase din 10 republ: Now, six in 10 Republicans have a favorable view of Donald Trump.

Un sondaj realizat s\u0103pt\u0103m\u00e: A Quinnipiac poll in Iowa last week found that 60 percent of Republicans there had a favorable view of Trump.
Dou\u0103 treimi dintre aleg\u0103torii: Two-thirds of GOP voters would be happy with Trump as the nominee.
\u00centr-un sondaj realizat s\u0103pt\u: In a CNN/ORC poll last week, 67 percent of Republicans said they would be either "enthusiastic" or "satisfied" if Trump were the nominee.
Doar doi din 10 declar\u0103 c\u0103 ar: Only two in 10 say they would be "upset" if he were the nominee.
Doar Ben Carson genereaz\u0103 aproximat: Only Ben Carson generates roughly the same level of enthusiasm as Trump (43 percent say they would be "enthusiastic" vs. 40 percent who say the same of Trump).
De partea cealalt\u0103, 47% dintre aleg: On the flip side, 47 percent of Republican voters say they would be "dissatisfied" or "upset" if establishment favorite Jeb Bush becomes the nominee.
Majoritatea republicanilor nu consider\u: A majority of Republicans don't see Trump's temperament as a problem.
De\u0219i Donald Trump a fost puternic c: While Donald Trump has been widely criticized for his bombast and insults, 52 percent of leaned Republican voters nationwide think that the real estate mogul has the right temperament to be president, according to Monday's ABC News/Washington Post poll.
Reg\u0103sim acelea\u0219i cifre \u00een: The same number holds in the first-in-the-nation caucus state of Iowa, where the same 52 percent of Republicans think he has the personality to be commander in chief, according to Quinnipiac last week.
Totu\u0219i, 44% sunt de p\u0103rere c\u: Still, 44 percent think he doesn't have the personality to serve effectively, and almost six in 10 independents say his temperament does not belong in the White House, according to ABC/Post.
Aleg\u0103torii republicani se obi\u0219: Republican voters are getting used to the idea.
Atunci c\u00e2nd iau atitudinea de intel: When they put on their pundit hats, Republican voters think Trump is for real.
Conform unui sondaj realizat s\u0103pt\u: When asked who is most likely to win the GOP nomination, four in 10 said Trump was the best bet, according to a CNN/ORC poll out last week.
Situa\u021bia s-a schimbat fa\u021b\u010: That's a change from when four in 10 placed their money on Jeb Bush in late July.
Informare complet\u0103: \u00een trecut,: Full disclosure: GOP voters haven't had the clearest crystal ball in the past.
\u00cen aceea\u0219i perioad\u0103 a ult: At this time last cycle, four in 10 Republicans picked Rick Perry to win the nomination, vs. only 28 percent for eventual nominee Mitt Romney.
\u00cens\u0103, aceste cifre arat\u0103: Still, it shows that a plurality of GOP voters see Trump's campaign as plausible.

Unele voci spun c\u0103 situa\u021bia di: Some pundits point out that the splintered field is likely contributing to Trump's lead, while anti-Trump support is be spread diffusely among more than a dozen other candidates.
\u00cens\u0103 un sondaj derulat la \u00: But a Monmouth University poll in early September shows that, in a hypothetical head-to-head matchup between Trump and most other Republican candidates, Trump almost always garners majority support.
Trump se afl\u0103 la distan\u021b\u0103: He leads Carly Fiorina by 13 points, Marco Rubio by 14 points, Walker by 15 points, Jeb Bush by 19 points, and, finally, Rand Paul, John Kasich and Chris Christie by 33 points each.
He's in a dead heat with Ted Cruz.
Singurul candidat care \u00eel \u00eenvi: The only candidate who beats him?
Ben Carson l-ar \u00eenvinge pe omul de: Ben Carson would lead the businessman by a wide 19 points in a hypothetical head-to-head.
Majoritatea sus\u021bin\u0103torilor lui: A bare majority of Donald Trump's supporters say they've made up their minds.
Un nou sondaj realizat mar\u021bi de CBS: A new CBS/NYT poll out on Tuesday shows that just more than half of voters who support Trump say they have locked in their votes.
Evident, se pot \u00eent\u00e2mpla multe: Obviously, a lot can happen to change that, and no one can really say they would never change their mind.
46% afirm\u0103 c\u0103 las\u0103 porti\: 46 percent said they are leaving the door open to switching candidates.
Cu toate acestea, cel mai important adve: Still, Trump's strongest competition at the moment is from fellow outsider neurosurgeon Ben Carson, but voters who say they have made up their minds are twice as likely to go for Trump.
\u0218ase din 10 republicani afirm\u0103: Six in 10 Republicans say they agree with Trump on immigration.
De c\u00e2nd Donald Trump i-a numit pe i: Even since Donald Trump called immigrants from Mexico "rapists" in his campaign announcement speech two months ago, immigration has been front and center in the 2016 conversation.
Unii sunt \u00eengrijora\u021bi c\u0103: Some are worried that Trump's bombast will drive crucial Hispanic voters away from the Republican Party and damage rebranding efforts.
\u00cens\u0103, conform sondajului reali: But according to Monday's new ABC/Post poll, six in 10 Republicans say they agree with Trump on immigration issues.
A\u0219a c\u0103, se pare c\u0103 at\u00: So as long as immigration remains in the spotlight, it seems Donald Trump will remain too.
Frustrarea fa\u021b\u0103 de autorit\u01: Frustration with government is climbing to new highs.
Donald Trump \u0219i Ben Carson sunt acu: Donald Trump and Ben Carson now account for roughly half of the support from Republican voters, largely due to their outsider status.
Conform sondajului realizat luni de ABC/: Six in 10 Republicans in Monday's new ABC/Post poll say they want a political outsider over someone with government experience.
Oamenii sunt de asemenea sup\u0103ra\u02: And they are angry at Washington, too.
Un sondaj derulat \u00een urm\u0103 cu d: A Des Moines Register/Bloomberg poll in Iowa from two weeks ago shows that three in four Iowa Republicans are frustrated with Republicans in Congress, with 54 percent "unsatisfied" and 21 percent "mad as hell."
Jeremy Corbyn \u00ee\u0219i face debutul: Jeremy Corbyn to make debut at Prime Minister's Questions
\u00cenc\u0103 de la alegerea sa, debutu: Since his election, Mr Corbyn's debut at PMQs has been keenly awaited
Noul lider al Partidului Laburist, Jerem: New Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn is to make his debut at Prime Minister's Questions later, taking on David Cameron for the first time.
Dl Corbyn va adresa primele dintre cele: Mr Corbyn will rise to ask the first of his six allotted questions shortly after midday, with his performance likely to be closely scrutinised by the media and Labour MPs.
\u00cen cadrul apari\u021biilor s\u0103p: He has called for "less theatre and more facts" at the weekly showpiece.
A declarat de asemenea c\u0103 poate ren: He has also said he could skip some sessions, leaving them to colleagues.
Confruntarea va fi primul test parlament: The encounter will be the first parliamentary test of Mr Corbyn's leadership, coming after his appointment of a shadow cabinet and his speech to the TUC annual congress on Tuesday.
\u00centre timp, decizia liderului Parti: Meanwhile, the Labour leader's decision to stand in silence during the singing of the national anthem at a service on Tuesday to mark the 75th anniversary of the Battle of Britain has attracted criticism from a number of Tory MPs and is the focus of several front page stories in the newspapers.
Decizia domnului Corbyn de a nu c\u00e2n: Mr Corbyn's decision not to sing the national anthem has attracted attention
Un purt\u0103tor de cuv\u00e2nt al Dl Co: A spokesman for Mr Corbyn said he had "stood in respectful silence" and did recognise the "heroism of the Royal Air Force in the Battle of Britain."
\u00cens\u0103 un membru al cabinetului: But a member of Mr Corbyn's shadow cabinet, Owen Smith, told BBC Two's Newsnight programme he would have advised the Labour leader to sing the national anthem "irrespective" of his belief that the monarchy should be abolished.
\u00cen jur de doisprezece mini\u0219tri: Nearly a dozen shadow ministers have refused to serve in Mr Corbyn's top team, citing differences over the economy, defence and foreign affairs, while less than a sixth of the parliamentary party originally backed him as leader.
Corespondentul politic al BBC, Robin Bra: BBC political correspondent Robin Brant says policy differences are also "stacking up" within Labour following Mr Corbyn's appointment over its position on the European Union and the government's cap on benefits.
Dl Corbyn a declarat la conferin\u021ba: Mr Corbyn told the TUC conference Labour was putting forward amendments to remove the whole idea of a cap altogether.
C\u00e2teva ore mai t\u00e2rziu, Dl Smit: Hours later Mr Smith, the shadow work and pensions secretary, said the party was "very clear" that it was only opposing government plans to reduce the level of cap from £26,000 to £23,000.
Dl Corbyn va fi al cincilea lider laburi: Mr Corbyn will be the fifth Labour leader that David Cameron has faced across the despatch box over the past decade since he became Tory leader.
Liderul laburist, care a promis o aborda: The Labour leader, who has promised a different approach to politics, says he has "crowd sourced" ideas for questions to ask Mr Cameron and has been given more than 30,000 suggestions.
Parlamentarul Islington North a afirmat: The Islington North MP has said PMQs is too confrontational and that he will refrain from both "repartee" and trading barbs, instead vowing to focus on serious issues such as poverty, inequality and the challenges facing young people.
Dl Corbyn a declarat c\u0103 Angela Eagl: Mr Corbyn has said that Angela Eagle, the shadow business secretary, will deputise for him at PMQs when he does not attend - for instance when Mr Cameron is travelling abroad.
A exprimat de asemenea ideea c\u0103 va: He has also floated the idea of allowing other colleagues to take the floor on occasion, saying he had approached the Commons Speaker John Bercow to discuss the issue.
\u00cen 2005, c\u00e2nd a preluat conduc: When he became leader in 2005, Mr Cameron said he wanted to move away from the "Punch and Judy" style of politics often associated with PMQs but admitted some years later that he had failed.
De la prima transmisie, \u00een 1990, PM: Since it was first televised in 1990, PMQs has been seen as a key barometer of a leader's judgement, their command of the Commons and their standing among their fellow MPs although critics have argued it has become a caricature and is in need of far-reaching reforms.

Thanasi Kokkinakis sus\u021binut de pre\: Thanasi Kokkinakis backed by Tennis Australia president Steve Healy
Thanasi Kokkinakis ar merita s\u0103 fie: Thanasi Kokkinakis deserves kudos rather than criticism for his behaviour.
Thanasi Kokkinakis a fost victim\u0103 c: Thanasi Kokkinakis has been the collateral damage in the recent storm around his friend Nick Kyrgios and deserves kudos rather than criticism for his own behaviour, according to Tennis Australia president Steve Healy.
Kokkinakis, partea mai t\u00e2n\u0103r\u: Kokkinakis, the younger of the talented duo regularly referred to as the "Special Ks," was dragged into an unwelcome spotlight by the infamous Kyrgios sledge of Stan Wawrinka at the Montreal Masters.
\u00centr-un meci cr\u00e2ncen de califi: In a fiery qualifying match in Cincinnati soon after, Kokkinakis and his opponent Ryan Harrison twice had to be separated by the chair umpire, with Harrison declaring: "Wawrinka should've decked Kyrgios, and I should deck that kid."
De\u0219i a fost v\u0103zut ultima dat\u: While he was last seen smashing a racquet after cramp foiled a potential US Open upset of Richard Gasquet, Kokkinakis has been defended staunchly by Healy.
Adolescentul se afl\u0103 \u00een prezen: The teenager is currently in Glasgow, competing with Sam Groth for the second singles berth behind Bernard Tomic in the Davis Cup semi-final against Britain.
\u201eUn lucru pe care \u00eel simt pute: "One thing I do feel quite keenly about is I think Thanasi's been dragged into the fray a little bit," Healy said.
Adev\u0103rul este c\u0103 a rupt o rach: He did break a racquet when he lost when he cramped in the US, but he's not the first player to break a racquet out of frustration with himself, and I know Thanasi well enough to know he wouldn't be proud of that.
Dar s\u0103 fim serio\u0219i, s-a st\u01: But, really, he's handled himself extremely well, in pretty provocative circumstances in the US with Harrison and so on, and I think he deserves a lot of credit.
Are o echip\u0103 extraordinar\u0103, ar: He's a great team around him, he's got a great family around him and I just think he's been a little hard done by.
Este un t\u00e2n\u0103r de 19 ani foarte: He's a very mature 19-year-old, he works very hard, and he fits in with the team and so on, he hasn't ever had an issue with the other players, he's well respected in the locker room, he trains hard, he's in great shape, he's a very stable and mature young guy and I just think he deserves to be judged on his own merits.
Healy a sus\u021binut de asemenea decizi: Healy also backed the decision to overlook Kyrgios for the important tie, starting on Friday, describing the "mutual decision" as the right thing for all, but backing the Canberran to return as a long-term fixture in the team.
\u201e\u00cen primul r\u00e2nd, ne dorim: "First of all we want the team to be completely focused on the tie and not all the controversy around [Kyrgios]," Healy said.
\u0218i cred c\u0103 Nick a urcat foarte: And I think Nick, he's risen very quickly, as people like Federer and Murray have pointed out, he's growing up in the public eye and he's made some terrible errors and deserves all the criticism he gets, but we're trying to support him, we're trying to help him understand the consequences of his actions, and some time out of the limelight where he can just reflect on that I think is appropriate and it's best for the team and it's best for him.
Alegeri 2016: Avantajul lui Hillary Clin: Election 2016: Hillary Clinton's lead over Bernie Sanders cut by half in national poll
Fostul Secretar de Stat, Hillary Clinton: Former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton continues to hold a double-digit lead in the Democratic race for the nomination nationally, but Sen. Bernie Sanders is gaining on her.
Clinton este acum sus\u021binut\u0103 de: Clinton now has the backing of 47 percent of Democratic primary voters (down from 58 percent), while Sanders comes in second, with 27 percent (up from 17 percent).
Vicepre\u0219edintele Joe Biden, care nu: Vice President Joe Biden, who has yet to announce whether he is running for president, receives support from 15 percent of Democratic primary voters.
Cu cel pu\u021bin cinci luni \u00eenaint: More than five months before the start of the primary contests, most Democratic voters say it is too early to say that their minds are made up about which candidate they will support.
\u00cens\u0103 sus\u021bin\u0103torii lu: But Clinton's backers are more firm in their choice than those backing other candidates.
Fa\u021b\u0103 de sondajul realizat de \: Since last month's CBS News Poll, Clinton has lost ground among a number of demographic groups, while Sanders has made some gains.
Clinton p\u0103streaz\u0103 avantajul \u: Clinton maintains a large lead among women and moderates, but those leads have narrowed.
Sus\u021binerea \u00een r\u00e2ndul b\u0: Her support among men has dropped considerably and Sanders only trails her by 5 points.
Avantajul lui Clinton \u00een r\u00e2ndu: Clinton's advantage with Democratic voters under age 50 has evaporated, and she and Sanders are now even.
Cu toate astea, Clinton se afl\u0103 \u0: However, Clinton still has a large lead with older voters.
Luna trecut\u0103, Clinton se afla \u00e: Last month, Clinton was ahead of Sanders by double-digits among liberals, but Sanders now has a 5-point edge with this group.
Aproximativ jum\u0103tate dintre aleg\u0: About half of Democratic primary voters nationwide say they would enthusiastically support Clinton if she became the party's nominee.
Un sfert ar sus\u021bine-o oarecum rezer: A quarter would support her with some reservations and another 15 percent would only back her because she is the nominee.
Six percent would not support her.
Poate nesurprinz\u0103tor, probabilitate: Perhaps not surprisingly, Clinton's current supporters are especially likely to be enthusiastic about her.
Opiniile sunt mai amestecate \u00een r\u: Views are more mixed among those not currently backing Clinton - only about a quarter would enthusiastically support her.
\u00cen timp ce 48% dintre aleg\u0103tor: While 48 percent of Democratic primary voters say they would enthusiastically back Clinton, fewer Republican voters say that about their frontrunner, Donald Trump (35 percent).
Atunci c\u00e2nd sus\u021bin\u0103torilo: When Clinton's supporters are asked in an open-ended question why they want her to be the nominee, the top answer is that she has the right experience (16 percent), followed by it's time for a woman president (13 percent), and that she is the best candidate for the job (10 percent).
Sus\u021bin\u0103torii lui Clinton men\u: Also mentioned by Clinton supporters is her association with Bill Clinton (9 percent).
Se men\u021bioneaz\u0103 de asemenea aco: Agreement on the issues, and electability are also cited.
Av\u00e2nd \u00een vedere c\u0103 vicepr: As the vice president weighs a potential run for president, 57 percent of Democratic primary voters would like to see him jump in the race - although a third don't think he should.
La \u00eentrebarea privind a doua op\u02: When Democratic primary voters are asked who would be their second choice for the party's nomination, Biden is the top pick.
Dintre sus\u021bin\u0103torii lui Clinto: Among Clinton supporters, more than half say Biden would be their second choice, far ahead of Sanders.
Dac\u0103 Biden decide s\u0103 nu candid: If Biden chooses not to run for the Democratic nomination, Hillary Clinton's lead over Sanders widens, from 20 points with Biden in the race to 30 points without him in the running.
55% dintre aleg\u0103torii democra\u021b: Fifty-five percent of Democratic voters see Clinton as the candidate with the best chance of winning the general election; however that figure is down from 78 percent last month.
Biden se afl\u0103 la distan\u021b\u0103: Biden is a distant second on this measure, but the percentage that sees him as the most electable has risen.
Cu toate acestea, atunci c\u00e2nd sunt: Still, when asked which is more important in a nominee, Democratic voters pick issues over electability.
La fel ca luna trecut\u0103, niciun cand: Similar to last month, no single Democratic candidate or potential candidate stands out as unacceptable as the nominee to these primary voters.
Candida\u021bii democra\u021bi sau posib: The Democratic candidates, or potential candidates, perform well on some key characteristics among their party's primary voters.
Majoritatea aleg\u0103torilor \u00eei co: Majorities see Clinton, Sanders and Biden as honest and trustworthy and as having strong leadership qualities.
Biden este v\u0103zut cel mai bine dintr: Biden does the best of the three on honesty, while Clinton's strength is leadership.
30% dintre aleg\u0103torii democra\u021b: Thirty percent of Democratic primary voters don't think Clinton is honest and trustworthy, twice as many as say that about Sanders (15 percent), but 27 percent don't have an opinion of him on this.
Aleg\u0103torii democra\u021bi consider\: Democratic primary voters also generally see Clinton, Sanders and Biden as in line with their views ideologically.
Referitor la toate aceste aspecte, aprox: On all of these measures, about a quarter of Democratic voters do not have an opinion of Sanders.
Cum \u00eentreb\u0103rile persist\u0103: As questions continue about Hillary Clinton's use of a personal email address and server while Secretary of State, most Democratic primary voters are satisfied with her explanation of the matter and say it hasn't impacted their overall views of her.
\u00cens\u0103 lucrurile stau altfel \u0: But it's a different story among the American public overall.
Jum\u0103tate dintre americani sunt nemu: Half of Americans are now dissatisfied with her explanation, while just about a third are satisfied.
Opinia public\u0103 s-a \u00eemp\u0103r\: The public's views on this were split back in March, shortly after the issue came to light.
Majoritatea americanilor declar\u0103 c\: Most Americans say the email controversy has had no effect on their overall opinions of Clinton, although 36 percent say their opinion of her has grown worse.
\u00cen principal republicanii, mai mult: It is mainly Republicans, more than six in 10, who say their views of Clinton have become worse.
De\u0219i aleg\u0103torii democra\u021bi: Even though Clinton is viewed as honest and trustworthy by her party's voters, this continues to be a problem for her among registered voters overall: only 32 percent see her as honest and trustworthy, down eight points from last month, and 15 points since May.
62% dintre aleg\u0103tori nu o consider\: Sixty-two percent of registered voters don't think of her as honest and trustworthy.
\u00cen acela\u0219i timp, 55% dintre al: At the same time, 55 percent of registered voters nationwide don't see Trump as honest and trustworthy either.
Totu\u0219i, at\u00e2t Clinton c\u00e2t: Both Clinton and Trump, however, get good marks on leadership.
Dintre cei \u0219ase candida\u021bi eval: Of the six candidates tested, Biden, Carson and Bush do the best on honesty.
Num\u0103rul celor care \u00eel consider: More see Sanders as honest than not, but like Carson, many don't have an opinion of him.
Marja de eroare pentru e\u0219antionul d: The margin of error for the sample of 351 Democratic primary voters is 6 percentage points.
Cinci membri ai fr\u0103\u021biei pu\u02: Five fraternity members charged in death of Baruch College freshman
La aproape doi ani dup\u0103 ce un stude: Nearly two years after a college student died during a fraternity hazing ritual in Pennsylvania's Pocono Mountains, murder charges have been filed against five people.
Membrii fr\u0103\u021biei Pi Delta Psi d: Members of New York City's Baruch College Pi Delta Psi fraternity brutally assaulted Chun "Michael" Deng during an initiation rite in September 2013 and delayed taking him to the hospital, contributing to his death, police said.
Sursele oficiale spun c\u0103 victima a: Officials said he was blindfolded, saddled with a 30-pound backpack full of sand, and repeatedly tackled while he tried to walk toward a target across a frozen field.
Dl. Deng a acuzat dureri de cap dup\u010: Mr. Deng eventually complained that his head hurt then fell unconscious.
Membrii fr\u0103\u021biei Pi Delta Psi n: Pi Delta Psi fraternity members did not call 911 after Deng passed out, and allegedly waited an hour before bringing him to a hospital, police say.
Au g\u0103sit \u00eens\u0103 timpul nece: They did, however, find time to change Deng's clothes, Google his symptoms, and contact Andy Meng, the fraternity's national president to seek advice, Police Chief Chris Wagner said at a news conference.
\u201e\u00cen acest moment, membrii au \: "At this point, members began to hide paraphernalia and basically put the fraternity's well-being over that of Michael Deng's," Chief Wagner said.
Nu a putut fi resuscitat \u0219i a murit: He could not be revived and he died the next morning.
Conform unui raport de autopsie, Deng a: According to an autopsy report, Deng was subjected to repeated blunt force trauma to his head, torso, and thighs.
\u201ePrea multe familii au fost devasta: "Too many families have been devastated as a result of fraternity hazing, with at least one student dying every year from hazing since 1970," Douglas Fierberg, an attorney representing Deng's family, said in a statement.
Fr\u0103\u021biile \u0219i membrii acest: Fraternities and their members must be held accountable, and this step by authorities is an important one.
Marele Juriu al districtului Monroe a re: A Monroe County grand jury recommended third-degree murder charges for the first five members.
Al\u021bi treizeci \u0219i doi mebrii ai: Thirty-two other fraternity members, including Mr. Meng, will also be charged with assault hazing and criminal conspiracy.
\u201eNe dorim s\u0103 tragem la r\u0103: "We want to hold not only the individuals involved, but if there's an organization that sanctioned it, whether officially or unofficially, we're going to hold them accountable as well," Wagner said at a news conference Tuesday.
Facultatea Baruch a interzis fr\u0103\u0: Baruch College banned the fraternity and the national fraternity revoked its affiliation with the local chapter.

Rata dob\u00e2nzii va cre\u0219te iar pi: A rate hike will come and the bull market will stumble, bond yields will climb and the economy will slip into a recession.
Ce nu \u0219tim este \u00een c\u00e2t ti: What we don't know is how long all of that will take and how long it will last.
\u00cen economie, istoria ofer\u0103 pu\: For the economy specifically, history offers little guide about timing.
Dup\u0103 prima cre\u0219tere ar ratei d: A recession has come as quickly as 11 months after the first rate hike and as long as 86 months.
Agresivitatea Rezervei federale de a cre: The Federal Reserve's aggressiveness in raising rates is often, though not always, a determinant in how the economy and financial assets respond.
De aceea, oficialii b\u0103ncii centrale: That's why officials at the U.S. central bank have stressed so vigorously that investors should not be focused on when it starts raising rates but rather the trajectory of how long it will take to normalize.
\u00centr-adev\u0103r, \u00een joc sunt: There are, indeed, multiple variables at play.
\u00cens\u0103, \u00een final, juc\u0103: In the end, however, market participants may find that all the rate-hike fuss may have been overdone.
\u201ePrima cre\u0219tere a ratei dob\u0: "The first hike from the Fed since the global financial crisis will inevitably be interpreted by some as signaling the end of the era of 'cheap money,' " Julian Jessop, chief global economist at Capital Economics, said in a note to clients.
Din contr\u0103, nu ne a\u0219tept\u0103: In contrast, we do not expect the gradual return of U.S. interest rates to more normal but still low levels to be the seismic shock that many seem to fear.
\u00cens\u0103 nu se poate spune c\u0103: That's not to say there won't be effects, however.
\u00cen continuare prezent\u0103m modul: Here's a look at how some areas of the economy could react, based on historical trends:
Av\u00e2nd \u00een vedere situa\u021bia: As the market has seen over the past month or so, anticipation of rate hikes can make things volatile for a while.
\u00cens\u0103, la momentul cre\u0219ter: Once the hike hits, though, the impact is not as dramatic.
\u201eSe pare c\u0103 exist\u0103 o tend: "It does seem there is a trend for equity returns to stall 12-24 months after the first hike, which again perhaps reflects the lag in monetary policy," Deutsche Bank analysts said in a recent study of what happens after the Fed hikes.
Mai exact, \u00een ultimii 35 de ani, pi: More specifically, the market over the past 35 years or so is most often up sharply - about 14 percent - heading into the rate hike, fairly flat in the 250 days after (average gain of 2.6 percent) then back to normal once 500 days have passed, with average return in the past six cycles of 14.4 percent, according to a recent analysis Bob Doll, chief equity strategist at Nuveen Asset Management, posted on Barron's.
Deutsche a declarat c\u0103 impactul asu: Deutsche said the impact on stocks tends to get more pronounced later in the rate-hiking cycle and returns begin to diminish.
Recesiunea este o realitate a vie\u021bi: Recessions are a fact of economic life, but rate hikes often help them along.
\u00cen situa\u021bia de fa\u021b\u0103,: In the current case, the Fed is facing some conditions that did not exist before and could hasten a recession.
Mai exact, produsul intern brut se va ap: Most notably, gross domestic product will be near its lowest point ever for a Fed rate hike.
Conform Deutsche Bank, din cele 118 cre\: According to Deutsche Bank, in the 118 rate hikes since 1950, only twice has nominal year over year GDP been below 4.5 percent.
Chiar dac\u0103 \u00een al doilea trimes: Even though the second quarter of 2015 was at 3.6 percent, few expect that to last, with the third quarter tracking at just 1.5 percent, according to the Atlanta Fed.
Cre\u0219terea ratei dob\u00e2nzii \u00e: Hiking rates into such a fragile economic backdrop could be risky and set up the question of "whether this time is different," Deutsche said.
Juc\u0103torii de pe pia\u021b\u0103 s-a: Market participants have been bracing for a Fed hike all year, with all eyes turned toward this week's Federal Open Market Committee meeting, which ends Thursday.
De\u0219i numero\u0219i strategi \u0219i: While many strategists and economists believe the FOMC could approve a hike at this meeting, futures trading indicates just a 25 percent probability.
\u201e\u00cen studiul nostru derulat dup: "In our study since 1950, all hiking cycles to date have been in a super cycle of increasing leverage with GDP eclipsing prerecession peaks very quickly post the recovery commencing," the report said.
Din contr\u0103, aceasta a fost o recupe: By contrast this has been a uniquely slow recovery from what was the worst recession in the sample period.
Ciclul actual este de departe cel mai lu: The current cycle is by far the longest the Fed has waited since the end of the last recession; the record had been 35 months, and this is 74 months and counting.
Venitul fix a fost de asemenea volatil a: Fixed income also has been volatile as the market anticipates a rate hike, and the pattern is somewhat similar to what equities experience.
Principala diferen\u021b\u0103 este c\u0: The principal difference is that the impact happens faster in bonds than stocks when the Fed changes course in policy.
\u00cen cazul obliga\u021biunilor, pare: For bonds, it does seem yields change direction immediately as the first hike/cut in the cycle arrives.
La finalul ciclului de cre\u0219tere a r: At the end of the hiking cycle bond yields fall immediately," Deutsche said.
Strategii Charles Schwab sunt de p\u0103: Charles Schwab strategists believe the hike in rates will cause yields between longer- and shorter-dated bonds to move closer together, flattening the curve.
Obliga\u021biunile cu rentabilitate \u00: High-yield bonds often perform better in such a climate, though "we are still cautious about stretching for yield," Kathy Jones, fixed income analyst at Schwab, said in an analysis.
\u00cen mod interesant, Jones este de p\: Interestingly, Jones thinks markets already have adapted to Fed policy expectations.
\u201ePe l\u00e2ng\u0103 puterea dolarul: "In addition to the strength in the dollar and the drop in inflation expectations, there are several signs that the market has adjusted to the prospect of tighter monetary policy," she wrote.
Ratele dob\u00e2nzilor pe termen scurt a: Short-term interest rates are up, the yield curve is flatter, credit spreads have widened and volatility has increased - all characteristics of the market when the Fed tightens policy.
\u00cen linii mari, companiile care \u00: Broadly speaking, companies that do the majority of their business in the U.S. will win as interest rates rise and local products become more attractive.
Multina\u021bionalele cu datorii mari vo: Multinationals with lots of debt will fare worse, as a rising dollar makes their products more expensive in the global market space and their debt more expensive the finance.
\u201eIstoria arat\u0103 c\u0103 stocuri: "History shows that 'quality' stocks tend to outperform during the three months following an initial rate hike," Goldman Sachs analysts said in a report for clients.
Firmele cu bilan\u021buri puternice le-a: Firms with strong balance sheets outpaced weak balance sheet companies following each of the 1994, 1999, and 2004 rate hikes, by an average of 5 percentage points.
Companiile cu \u00eencas\u0103ri mari di: Companies with high returns on capital as well as low volatility stocks also outperformed their lower quality counterparts, by an average of 4 (percentage points) and 3 (percentage points), respectively.
Datoria va deveni o problem\u0103 import: Debt will become a big issue.
Companiile cu un procent mare de datorie: Companies with a high percentage of floating rate debt stand to lose the most, Goldman said.
Consumatorii vor avea de asemenea de c\u: Outside pure stock plays, consumers stand to benefit as well through the rising dollar.
Cei care economisesc ar putea avea de as: Savers could see gains as well through higher yields at the, though experts differ on how quickly that will take hold.

Tab\u0103ra Brexit ar putea avea c\u00e2: Brexit camp might win the day if economy is in doldrums by 2017

Corbyn to the Labour leadership, or the TUC cutting up rough over Europe on Tuesday.
Str\u0103inii au \u0219i ei personaje pr: Foreigners have their Corbyns and Nigel Farages too.
Un diplomat european a explicat zilele t: A European diplomat chum explained the other day that, sunk in assorted crises as the EU is - not all of their own making - some member states are fed up with Britain's self-absorbed agenda of divisive concessions and disruptive treaty changes which they mostly don't want.
\u00cen Brighton, cu ocazia \u00eent\u00: In Brighton for its annual bean, the TUC decided it didn't want them either if they eroded social protection.
Am putea chiar s\u0103 o numim agenda \u: We could even call it Dave and George's selfie agenda.
Prim ministrul \u0219i cancelarul partic: PM and chancellor rock up to summits or bilateral sessions in foreign capitals, take a photo of themselves in front of a famous local monument, with or without local grandee, then come home and say they are winning allies for reform.
Prietenul meu european, care dore\u0219t: My European pal, who wants an outward-looking Britain inside the EU tent - "Don't leave us alone with France," says Berlin - suggests that more short-sighted ministers and officials in some capitals have got to the point where they don't care whether we stay or leave.
Angela Merkel, cancelarul german extrem: Angela Merkel, Germany's cautiously level-headed chancellor, is an ally, but has been in power for 10 years and wants to leave office before it goes bad for her, as it did for overstayers Thatcher (11 years), Mitterrand (14) and Kohl (16).
\u00cen 2017, pre\u0219edintele Fran\u02: France's François Hollande is facing re-election or replacement in 2017.
He is a fading force too.
Polonia ar putea avea cur\u00e2nd un guv: Poland may soon have a nationalistic government of the right, Spain one of the left.
Este greu de crezut c\u0103 acestea \u00: It's hard to see them breaking a leg to help the Selfie Brits, whose energy might be better spent preventing Scotland leaving the UK - something they don't want either because most have similar separatist tendencies.
Astfel, unii mini\u0219tri ar putea pl\u: So some such ministers may even be planning to make deliberately unhelpful remarks, SNP-style, during the UK's 2017 referendum campaign to hasten the Brexit process, my pal suggests.
\u201eRenegocierea a fost fix\u0103\u201: "The renegotiation was a fix" and "Britain got nothing of value out of the renegotiation."

Poate \u00ee\u0219i amintesc vag de Bori: They may dimly remember Boris Johnson, the arch Euro-opportunist, making his name as an "EU straight bananas" Brussels correspondent in the early 90s.
Ed Miliband \u00ee\u0219i cuno\u0219tea: For all his foolishness Ed Miliband knew who his enemies were.
Au inclus amestecul de punga\u0219i nepl: They included the medley of tax-shy rascals, phone-hacking foreigners and pseudo non-doms who own most of our great newspapers.
De fapt, Tony Blair \u00eei vedea cam la: Actually Tony Blair thought much the same about them, but realised that when you're in a cage with a randy gorilla you have to pass the bananas to distract it from having you for lunch and again for tea.
De fapt, Miliband a fost mai Blairite de: In fact Miliband was more Blairite than Blair in opposing Cameron's referendum wheeze, since Blair had conceded the principle over the EU's aborted constitution, sunk by French and Dutch voters in 2005 who gave him a get-out card.
The press never forgave him that either.
\u00cens\u0103 Jeremy Corbyn, care m-a a: But nice Jeremy Corbyn, who gave me a friendly pat on the back at Westminster on Monday - I told him he no longer has time to waste on me - seems to be in danger of re-adopting Neil Kinnock's boycott Murdoch strategy of the 80s, a mistake then and now.

Pozi\u021bia oficial\u0103 a lui Corbyn: Corbyn's official position on Europe is what I will kindly call evolving.
Acesta declar\u0103 c\u0103 \u0219i-ar d: He says he'd like us to stay in a reformed EU.
Majoritatea celor care nu sunt de acord: Well, most people outside Ukip's woad-wearing tendency and the wilder shores of Tory little Englanderism can probably say yes to that.
Asta a declarat Hilary \u201eUn Benn, \u: It's what Hilary "A Benn, but not a Bennite" Benn said on radio and TV this week as the boy scout in him struggled not to admit that Corbyn's appointment of abrasive John McDonnell as shadow chancellor was a bad idea.

\u00cens\u0103 lupta pentru a r\u0103m\u: But fighting to stay in "in all circumstances" - Benn's phrase - was not what McDonnell was saying, nor what JC told peers and MPs at their private meeting on Monday night, by all accounts.
Indiferent de imaginea pe care dore\u021: Whatever the bottom-up, touchy-feely image Corbyn wants to convey - remember, he even touched me - message discipline remains important in the age of 24/7 TV and especially in the maelstrom that is social media, a hotbed of paranoia and betrayal.
Este corect s\u0103 nu i se acorde lui C: It's fair enough not to give Cameron a free pass on Europe, allowing him to take Labour's support for granted in the referendum campaign, as McDonnell has said.
\u00cens\u0103 sofismul de baz\u0103 al: But McDonnell and Corbyn's basic equivocation about EU membership - consistent with their Bennite siege economy, anti-capitalist past - is no longer just a matter of esoteric discussion among leftwing dissidents for whom the narcissism of small difference is a central tenet of doctrinal squabbles.
Ca \u0219i \u00een cazul sofismului s\u0: As with his equivocation over Nato - Tom Watson is adamant that JC won't campaign to quit - foreign diplomats will be obliged to try to make sense of it all for their masters at home.

Speciali\u0219tii critic\u0103 decizia D: Experts criticise Public Health England e-cigarettes review
Conform cercet\u0103torilor, afirma\u021: Claims by a government-funded agency that e-cigarettes are 95% less harmful than smoking arose from a meeting of 12 people, some with links to the tobacco industry, researchers have said.
Speciali\u0219tii din echipa editorial\u: Experts writing in the British Medical Journal (BMJ) joined the Lancet in criticising the evidence used by Public Health England (PHE) in its report on e-cigarettes.
PHE a publicat raportul \u201ede referin: PHE published the "landmark" report last month, describing it as a "comprehensive review of the evidence."
C\u00e2\u021biva cercet\u0103tori au pus: But several researchers have questioned the robustness of the data and pointed to links between some experts and the tobacco industry.
Un articol publicat luna trecut\u0103 \u: An editorial in the Lancet medical journal last month attacked the "extraordinarily flimsy foundation" on which PHE based its main conclusion.
Al\u021bi doi cercet\u0103tori care scri: Writing in the BMJ, two further researchers have questioned whether the claims were "built on rock or sand."
Martin McKee, profesor de s\u0103n\u0103: Martin McKee, professor of European public health at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, and Simon Capewell, professor of clinical epidemiology at the University of Liverpool, said: "A fundamental principle of public health is that policies should be based on evidence of effectiveness."
Au afirmat c\u0103 se a\u0219teapt\u0103: They said the public would expect PHE's claims that "the current best estimate is that e-cigarettes are around 95% less harmful than smoking" would be based on a detailed review of evidence and modelling.
\u00cen realitate, o singur\u0103 \u00ee: In fact, it comes from a single meeting of 12 people convened to develop a multi-criteria decision analysis (MCDA) model to synthesise their opinions on the harms associated with different nicotine-containing products; the results of the meeting were summarised in a research paper.
McKee \u0219i Capewell sau afirmat c\u01: McKee and Capewell said one sponsor of the meeting was a company called EuroSwiss Health, whose chief executive was reported to have previously received funding from British American Tobacco for an independent study.
Acesta a validat de asemenea acreditarea: He also endorsed BAT's public health credentials in a sustainability report, they said.
Ei au ad\u0103ugat c\u0103 unul dintre c: One of the 12 people at the meeting declared funding from an e-cigarette manufacturer but not the funding he was reported to have received previously from the tobacco company Philip Morris International, they added.
Nu s-au furnizat argumentele pe baza c\u: The rationale for selecting the members of the panel is not provided, but they include several known e-cigarette champions, some of whom also declare industry funding in the paper.
Al\u021bi participan\u021bi la \u00eent\: Some others present at the meeting are not known for their expertise in tobacco control.
La \u00eent\u00e2lnire a participat de a: The meeting was also attended by the tobacco lead at PHE.
Lucrarea de cercetare elaborat\u0103 de: The research paper produced by the group "tellingly concedes" there is a lack of "hard evidence for the harms of most products on most of the criteria," McKee and Capewell wrote.
Cu toate acestea, \u00een raportul PHE n: However, none of these links or limitations are discussed in the PHE report.
McKee \u0219i Capewell au declarat c\u01: McKee and Capewell said PHE's claims that "there is no evidence so far that e-cigarettes are acting as a route into smoking for children or non-smokers" were premature.
Profesorul Kevin Fenton, directorul depa: Prof Kevin Fenton, director of health and wellbeing at PHE, said the claims in the BMJ had been responded to before.
El a declarat: \u201e\u021aig\u0103rile: He said: "E-cigarettes are significantly less harmful than smoking."
Una din dou\u0103 persoane care au fumat: One in two lifelong smokers dies from their addiction.
Toate dovezile sugereaz\u0103 c\u0103 ri: All of the evidence suggests that the health risks posed by e-cigarettes are small by comparison, but we must continue to study the long-term effects.
PHE are datoria clar\u0103 de a informa: PHE has a clear duty to inform the public about what the evidence shows and what it does not show, especially when there was so much public confusion about the relative dangers compared to tobacco.
Anual, aproximativ 80.000 de persoane \u: Nearly 80,000 people a year die of a smoking-related illness and smoking costs the NHS £2bn a year.
Exprim\u00e2nd clar dovezile actuale - \: By spelling out clearly the current evidence - that while e-cigarettes are not risk-free, they carry only a fraction of the harm caused by smoking - we are fulfilling our national remit.
